instructions.title: How to Log In & Log Out of Your TGR Account
instructions.content:
_*How to Log In to Your TGR Account*_
https://youtu.be/0dqVqZrWg6Q

1.  *Open Your Web Browser*: Launch your preferred web browser, such as Google Chrome.
2.  *Go to the Login Page*: In the address bar, type the official TGR login URL or just click this: https://www.topupandgetreward.com/account/dashboard
3.  *Enter Your Credentials*: On the "Login Now" page, enter the email address and password that you used to register for the account.
4.  *Log In*: Tap the blue "Login Now" button to access your account.
5.  *Read Important Announcements*: After logging in, a pop-up window with important service updates and information will appear. It is crucial to read these announcements to stay informed about network availability or transaction updates.
6.  *Access Your Dashboard*: Once you have read the announcement, close the pop-up window to view your main dashboard, which displays your commission and wallet balances.

_*How to Log Out of Your TGR Account*_

It is very important to always log out properly after completing your transactions to ensure your account remains secure.

1.  *Find Your Username*: On your dashboard, locate your username displayed at the top right of the screen.
2.  *Open the Account Menu*: Tap on your username. A dropdown menu will appear with the options "Profile" and "Logout."
3.  *Select Logout*: Tap on "Logout" from the menu. You will be redirected back to the login page.
4.  *Close the Browser Tab*: For best security practice and to prevent "session expired" errors later, completely close the browser tab you were using for your TGR session.

instructions.title: How to Move Commissions to Your Wallet
instructions.content:
_*How to Move Commissions to Your Current Wallet*_
https://youtu.be/wjnRwqutNjo

If you have run out of funds in your main wallet but have accumulated commissions, you can easily transfer those earnings to continue making transactions.

1.  *Log In to Your TGR Account*: Open your web browser and log in to your account at https://www.topupandgetreward.com/account/dashboard with your registered email and password.
2.  *Open the Menu*: On your main dashboard, tap the menu icon (three horizontal lines) located at the top-left corner of the screen.
3.  *Navigate to "My Account"*: In the menu that appears, tap on *My Account*.
4.  *Go to Commissions*: A dropdown list will appear under "My Account." Tap on *Commission* from this list.
5.  *Access the Withdraw Function*: On the Commissions page, you will see your total commission balance displayed in a red box. Tap the *settings icon* (shaped like a gear) within this box. A "Withdraw" button will appear.
6.  *Initiate the Withdrawal*: Tap the *Withdraw* button. A dialog box will pop up, prompting you to enter the amount you wish to transfer.
7.  *Enter the Amount*: Type in the exact amount you want to move from your commission balance to your wallet. You can transfer the full amount or a partial amount.
8.  *Confirm the Transfer*: After entering the amount, tap the *Send* button. You will see a "Success! Your Transfer was successful" notification.
9.  *Verify the Transfer*: To confirm that the funds have been moved, navigate back to your *Dashboard*. You will see that your "Current Commission Balance" is now ‚Ç¶0.00 and the transferred amount has been added to your "Current Wallet Balance."

You can now use the funds in your wallet to continue your transactions.

instructions.title: How to Buy Airtime on the TGR Platform
instructions.content:
_*How to Buy Airtime on the TGR Platform*_
https://youtu.be/LX833Qn2RyQ

This guide will walk you through the process of logging into your account and purchasing airtime for any network.

1.  *Log In to Your Account*:
    Open your web browser (e.g., Google Chrome) and go to the TGR login page: https://www.topupandgetreward.com/account/dashboard
    Enter your registered *email address* and *password*.
    Tap the *"Login Now"* button to access your account dashboard.

2.  *Navigate to the Airtime Recharge Section*:
    Once you are on your dashboard, tap the *menu icon* (three horizontal lines) at the top-left corner of the screen.
    From the menu that appears, scroll down to the "TRANSACTIONS" section and select *"Airtime Recharge."*

3.  *Select the Network Provider*:
    On the "Mobile Topup" page, you will see logos for different network providers (MTN, Glo, 9mobile, Airtel).
    Tap on the logo of the network you want to buy airtime for. The selected logo will become highlighted.

4.  *Enter the Recharge Details*:
    In the first field, labeled "Enter receiver number," carefully type the *phone number* you wish to send the airtime to.
    In the second field, labeled "Enter recharge amount," type the *amount* of airtime you want to purchase (e.g., 300, 500, 1000).

5.  *Complete the Transaction*:
    Double-check that the phone number and amount are correct.
    Tap the green *"Pay"* button.
    The transaction will process, and a pop-up message will appear confirming *"Transaction Successful!"* Tap *"OK"* to close it.

You have now successfully purchased airtime. A commission for this transaction will be automatically added to your "Current Commission Balance" on your dashboard.

instructions.title: How to Fund Your TGR Wallet (One-Time Funding)

*1. Log In to Your New Account*
   - Go to https://www.topupandgetreward.com/account/dashboard
   - Log in using the *email address* and *password* you just registered with.

*2. Go to Your Profile Page*
   - Once logged in, tap on your *username* at the top-right corner of the screen.
   - From the dropdown menu, select *Profile*.

*3. Generate a Temporary Payment Account*
   - On your profile page, you will see a blue button that says *"One-Time Funding"*.
   - Tap this button *once*.
   - The system will immediately generate a *temporary Providus Bank account number* for you.
   - _*Important:*_ This account number is valid for only *30 minutes* and can only be used *once*.

*4. Transfer the Money*
   - Copy the generated Providus Bank account number.
   - Go to your personal banking app, or use a POS agent, to transfer the money to this account.
   - ‚ö†Ô∏è *YOU MUST ADD THE BANK CHARGE!* ‚ö†Ô∏è
     - For all transfers, add a *‚Ç¶45* charge.
       _Example: For a ‚Ç¶5,000 payment, you must transfer ‚Ç¶5,045._
       _Another Example: For a ‚Ç¶50,000 payment, you must transfer ‚Ç¶50,045._

   - _*Note:*_ When you make the transfer, the account name that appears might be "TGR(Your Name)" or something different. Don't worry, just proceed with the payment. As long as the account number is correct, the money will be credited to your TGR wallet.

instructions.title: How to Fund Your TGR Wallet (Manual Funding)
instructions.content:
*HOW TO FUND YOUR TGR WALLET (MANUAL FUNDING)* üè¶
https://youtu.be/IVmdi1s-43I

Use this method if you want to fund your wallet by making a direct bank transfer to the company's account.

*1. Find the Company's Bank Details*
   - First, you need the official TGR bank accounts. You can find these on the *Information Page*.
   - To get there, tap the *menu icon* (‚ò∞) -> *My Account* -> *Information*.
   - Scroll down to the *"MANUAL FUNDING PROCEDURE"* section. You will see a list of bank accounts (GTBank, First Bank, Zenith, etc.).

*2. Make Your Bank Transfer*
   - Copy one of the account numbers.
   - Go to your bank app, use a USSD code, or visit a POS agent to transfer the money.
   - _*IMPORTANT:*_ In the transaction *narration* or *reference*, you *must* put your TGR username (e.g., _DammieOptimus2_). This is how they identify who made the payment.

   - _*Note on Charges:*_
     - If your deposit is *‚Ç¶10,000 or more*, a ‚Ç¶50 Stamp Duty charge will be deducted. So, if you transfer ‚Ç¶10,000, you will get ‚Ç¶9,950.

*3. Upload Your Proof of Payment*
   - After a successful transfer, take a screenshot of the receipt.
   - Go back to your TGR dashboard.
   - Tap the *menu icon* (‚ò∞) -> *Support* -> *Bank Payment*.
   - Fill out the form:
     - *Amount*: The exact amount you transferred.
     - *Narration*: Select *"WALLET FUNDING"*.
     - *Teller ID/Transfer Ref*: Enter your TGR username again.
     - *Depositor*: The name on the bank account you transferred from.
     - *Source Bank*: The bank you sent the money from (e.g., Access Bank).
     - *TGR Bank*: The company bank you sent the money to (e.g., GTB).
     - *Transaction File*: Tap *"Choose File"* and upload the screenshot of your payment.
   - Tap *"Submit"*.

Your wallet will be credited within one hour after the TGR admin confirms your payment.

instructions.title: How to Buy Data When You Have No Data (Via E-PIN)
instructions.content:
*How to Buy Data on TGR When You Have No Data* üì∂‚ú®
https://youtu.be/-7GBPypoz-8?si=YPST2cV_7A7Nqadc

Hello! Ever run out of data and realised you need data to buy more data? TGR has a solution for that!

This guide explains how to generate an *E-PIN* (recharge PIN) on the TGR platform, which you can load on your phone using a USSD code, even with zero data.

_*Important Note:* This feature is only available for fully activated TGR members. If your account is not yet activated, you won't see the "E-PIN" option._

*PART 1: GENERATE AN E-PIN ON TGR* üì≤

_*Do this before you run out of data, or use a friend's phone to log in if you're already out of data.*_

*1. Log In to Your TGR Dashboard*
   - Log in with your email and password.

*2. Go to the E-PIN Menu*
   - Tap the *menu icon* (three horizontal lines) at the top-left.
   - Scroll down to the *TRANSACTIONS* section.
   - Tap on *"E-PIN"*.

*3. Create Your Recharge PIN*
   - On the "Recharge PIN" page, select the network provider (e.g., *Airtel*, *MTN*, *Glo*).
   - *Enter value of pin to produce*: Type the airtime amount you want (e.g., `100`).
   - *Enter quantity to produce*: Type how many PINs you want (e.g., `5`).
   - Tap the green *"Pay"* button.

*4. Get Your E-PIN*
   - After a successful transaction, the page will display the generated *E-PIN* and a *Serial Number*.
   - Copy the *E-PIN* and save it somewhere safe (like your notepad or send it to yourself via SMS).

---

*PART 2: HOW TO FIND YOUR E-PIN IF YOU MISSED IT* üìÇ

If you accidentally closed the page before copying the PIN, don't worry! Here‚Äôs how to find it:

*1. Go to E-PIN History*
   - Tap the *menu icon* again.
   - Scroll down to *"E-PIN History"*.
   - Select the network for the PIN you created (e.g., *Airtel E-PIN*).

*2. Search by Batch Number*
   - First, find the *Batch Number* for your transaction on the *"Commission"* page (under the "My Account" menu).
   - Go back to the E-PIN History page, paste the *Batch Number* into the search box, and tap *"Search"*.
   - Your generated E-PIN will be displayed. Copy it.

---

*PART 3: LOAD THE E-PIN AND BUY DATA* üåê

Now that you have the E-PIN, you can load it without needing an internet connection.

*1. Load the Airtime*
   - Open your phone's dialer.
   - Dial the USSD code for your network and enter the E-PIN you copied.
     - *MTN*: `*311*PIN#` or `*888*PIN#` (for AWUF)
     - *Airtel*: `*311*PIN#`
     - *Glo*: `*311*PIN#`
     - *9mobile*: `*311*PIN#`

*2. Convert Airtime to Data*
   - Once the airtime is loaded, dial your network's USSD code for buying data (e.g., `*312#` for MTN).
   - Follow the prompts to purchase a data bundle using your airtime balance.

And that‚Äôs it! You now have data on your phone, all thanks to TGR's E-PIN feature. ‚ú®

instructions.title: How to Register a New TGR Account
instructions.content:
*How to Register on Top Up and Get Reward (TGR)* ‚úçÔ∏è
https://youtu.be/CUu1MeR4Gx4

Hello! This guide will show you how to register a new account on the TGR platform using a referral link.

*Step 1: Click the Registration Link* üñ±Ô∏è
- The person who introduced you to TGR will send you a unique registration link. Tap on this link to open the registration page. https://www.topupandgetreward.com/register?referralid=TYPE-YOUR-REFERRAL-ID-HERE
- You will be taken to the TGR registration portal.

*Step 2: Fill in Your Profile Information* üìù
- The first field you will see is *Referral ID*. _*Please do not touch, edit, or change this ID.*_ It is already filled in for you.
- Scroll down and fill in the following details:
  - *First Name* should be what your Surname is in your NIN
  - *Last Name* should be what your First Name and Middle Name is in your NIN
    _Please note that what you fill above will be used as your bank account name_
  - *Email Address* (make sure it's a valid one)
  - *Phone Number* (make sure it is correct)
- After filling these in, tap the green *"Next"* button.

*Step 3: Create Your Login Details* üîê
- *Username*: Create a unique username. _*Important: Do not use any spaces in your username.*_ (e.g., use "JohnDoe" instead of "John Doe") Also, don't use any special characters. You can use only letters and numbers.
- *Password*: Choose a secure password you can remember.
- *Confirm Password*: Re-type the password to confirm it.
- Tap *"Next"*.

*Step 4: Add Your Bank Details* üè¶
- This is the account where your earnings and commissions will be sent when you make withdrawals.
- *Bank*: Select your bank from the dropdown list. _(Note: TGR does not currently support online-only banks like Opay or Kuda for withdrawals. Please use a traditional commercial bank. Also, don't use GTB or Stanbic IBTC for now so as to avoid withdrawal issues in the future.)_
- *Account Number*: Enter your bank account number.
- Tap *"Next"*.

*Step 5: Submit Your Registration* ‚úÖ
- You will be taken to the final confirmation page.
- Review all the information you have entered to ensure it is correct.
- Tap the red *"Submit"* button to complete your registration.

You should see a success message confirming your registration. You can now log in to your new TGR account.
The next step is to pay for your registration and activate yourself.

instructions.title: How to Upgrade Your TGR Membership Package
instructions.content:
*How to Upgrade Your TGR Membership Package* üöÄ

Hello! This guide explains how to upgrade your TGR account from a lower package (like Pearl Mini) to a higher one (like Diamond) to increase your earning potential.

_*Important Note:* You must have enough funds in your TGR wallet to cover the cost of the upgrade. For example, to upgrade from a ‚Ç¶2,500 package to a ‚Ç¶50,000 package, you'll need the difference of ‚Ç¶47,500 in your wallet._

*Step 1: Log In to Your TGR Account* üîë
   - Open your web browser and go to the TGR login page.
   - Enter the email and password for the account you wish to upgrade.

*Step 2: Go to Your Profile Page* üë§
   - Once you are logged into your dashboard, find your *username* at the top-right of the page and tap on it.
   - A dropdown menu will appear. Tap on *"Profile"*.
   
   _*Alternative:*_ You can also tap the *menu icon* (three horizontal lines) at the top-left, tap *"My Account"*, and then select *"Profile"*.

*Step 3: Find the Upgrade Option* ‚¨ÜÔ∏è
   - On your profile page, scroll all the way to the bottom.
   - You will see your current membership package displayed (e.g., "Pearl Mini").
   - Below your current package, tap the blue *"Upgrade"* button.

*Step 4: Select Your New Package* ‚ú®
   - A pop-up window titled *"Membership Upgrade"* will appear.
   - *Package*: Tap the first dropdown menu and select the new, higher package you want to upgrade to (e.g., *"Diamond"*).
   - *Select Payment*: In the second dropdown, choose *"Wallet"* as your payment method. This will use the funds already in your TGR account.
   - Tap the final blue *"Upgrade"* button to confirm.

*Step 5: Confirmation* ‚úÖ
   - If the payment is successful, you will see a *"Success! Upgrade Successful"* message.
   - Your account is now upgraded to the new package, and you can immediately start enjoying the increased benefits and earning potential!

That's it! Upgrading is a simple way to maximize your earnings on TGR. üìà

instructions.title: How to Check Your Transaction History & Status
instructions.content:
*How to Check the Status of Transactions From Your TGR Transaction History Page* üìäüì±

Hello! This guide will show you how to check the status of any transaction on your TGR dashboard. This is your first step for customer service before contacting support.

https://youtu.be/LYYhyytNNWc
https://youtu.be/w064DgaMI64
---

*PART 1: HOW TO FIND YOUR TRANSACTION HISTORY* üìÇ

*1. Open the Menu*
   - Log in to your TGR dashboard: https://www.topupandgetreward.com/account/dashboard
   - Tap the three horizontal lines (‚ò∞) at the top left to open the main menu.

*2. Go to "My Account"*
   - In the menu, tap on *My Account*. This will show a dropdown list of more options.

*3. Select "History"*
   - Scroll down the list and tap on *History*. This will take you to your general transaction history page.

---

*PART 2: HOW TO VIEW THE FULL TRANSACTION DETAILS* üñ•Ô∏è

_*Important:*_ _On a mobile phone, you can't see the full transaction table, including the crucial "Status" column. You need to switch to desktop view._

*1. Open Your Browser Menu*
   - While on the history page, tap the three dots (‚ãÆ) at the top right corner of your Chrome browser.

*2. Switch to Desktop Site*
   - In the browser menu, find and tick the box for *Desktop site*.

*3. View the Full Table*
   - The page will reload in a wider format. You can now zoom in and scroll to the right to see *all the details* of your transactions, including the *Status* column.

---

*PART 3: UNDERSTANDING THE TRANSACTION STATUS* üö¶

Here‚Äôs what each status means:

‚úÖ *PAID*: The transaction was *successful*.

‚è≥ *PENDING* or *INITIATED*: The transaction is still processing. Please be patient and check back later.

üîÑ *REFUNDED*: The transaction failed, and the money was *automatically returned* to your TGR wallet.

‚ùå *FAILED*: The transaction was not successful. _*Do not repeat a failed transaction!*_ Always check your history first to see if it was refunded.

By checking your history this way, you can solve most issues yourself without needing to wait for customer support.

instructions.title: How to Contact TGR Customer Support (Open a Ticket)
instructions.content:
*A User's Guide to Contacting TGR Support*

This guide explains how to raise a support ticket if you have a complaint or an issue, such as a problem with funding your wallet.

https://youtu.be/NSgZTMGKw3M
and
https://youtu.be/5x7GDgzxJ6s

---

*PART 1: HOW TO CREATE A SUPPORT TICKET* üìù

*1. Log In to Your Account*
   - Go to your TGR dashboard.

*2. Navigate to the Support Section*
   - On the left-hand menu, scroll down to the *SUPPORT TICKET* section.
   - Tap on *Support* to see more options.

*3. Open a New Ticket*
   - Tap on *Open Ticket*.

*4. Fill Out the Ticket Form*
   - *Subject*: Give your issue a clear, short title.
     _Example: WALLET NOT FUNDED_

   - *Description*: Explain your problem in detail. Include important information like:
     - The transaction amount (e.g., _N10,000_)
     - The bank you paid from (e.g., _GTBank_)
     - The account name used for the payment
     - The Providus account number you sent the money to

   - *Priority*: Choose the urgency level. For funding issues, select *High*.

   - *Category*: Choose the type of issue. For funding, select *Transaction*.

*5. Submit the Ticket*
   - After filling in all the details, tap the *Submit* button.

---

*PART 2: HOW TO CHECK FOR REPLIES* üì¨

_*Important: Do not create a new ticket for the same issue. Always check for a reply on the original ticket first.*_

*1. Go to "My Tickets"*
   - Go back to the *Support* section in the main menu.
   - Tap on *My Tickets*.

*2. Check the Ticket Status*
   - You will see a list of all your tickets. Look at the *Status* column.
   - If it says *"Admin Reply,"* the support team has responded to you.

*3. View and Respond to the Reply*
   - Tap on the ticket's *Subject* to open it.
   - Read the admin's message.
   - If you need to add more information, scroll down, type your message in the *Reply* box, and tap the *Reply* button.

---

*PART 3: HOW TO CLOSE A TICKET* ‚úÖ

Once your problem has been solved, you can close the ticket.

*1. Open the Resolved Ticket*
   - Go to *My Tickets* and tap on the subject of the ticket that has been resolved.

*2. Mark as Complete*
   - At the top right of the ticket page, tap the green *Mark as Complete* button. This will close the ticket.

That's it! This is the official way to communicate with the TGR support team for any issues.
